subject: Standard Operating Procedure for Conciliation provided in the Contract / Concession Agreement for the Disputes/ Claims Recommended/ Decided by Dispute Resolution Board (DRB) - reg.
text: HRally 74 <THRfgiferarrut (Tga5 4aev &1r RoTAPf #RG FRTSR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Haia Ta vil-5 & 6, 7d27-10, ERqhT, #8 @ecft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 /Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI /Policy Guidelines /Dispute Resolution /2025 Policy Circular No.2.1.80/ 2025 dated 13th February, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/CMD/CCIE/2018(Part1) (Comp. No. 121843)} Sub: Standard Operating Procedure for Conciliation provided in the Contract Concession Agreement for the Disputesl Claims Recommended/ Decided by Dispute Resolution Board (DRB) reg: NHAI vide Policy Circular No_ 2.1.23/2017 dated 02.06.2017 established a System for Conciliation of Disputes through Conciliation Committee of Independent Experts (CCIEs)  Modified SOP for Conciliation was issued vide Policy Circular No. 2.1.48 dated 09.04.2021_ This covers all the disputes under the Project till date of referring the matter to CCIE at any Stage (like not yet referred to AT, referred to AT awarded and challenged in the Court) Timelines to process the matters for referring to CCIEs was issued vide Policy Circular No. 2.1.50, dated 26.05.2021_ 2 Articles 26, 38, and 44 of the Standard Agreements for EPC, HAM; and BOT (Toll) Projects post September 2020 include Provisions for Dispute Resolution as under: If either Party is dissatisfied with the decision of DRB, 0r if DRB is unable to resolve the dispute, the Parties are required to explore Conciliation through CCIEs established by the Authority before proceeding to Arbitration. If the Conciliation process through CCIE fails, either Party may escalate the Dispute to Arbitration. 3_ It has been observed that numerous Disputes/ Claims Decided / Recommended at DRB Level are coming up for Conciliation, where one or both Parties are dissatisfied with the decision of DRB. In such Cases, each decision / recommendation of DRB is to be dealt with in Conciliation separately and all Disputes/ Claims need not be firmed up for presenting before CCIE. ideordinglyeso SOP dated 09.04.2021 is replaced with the SOP given below for Cases, as decided in on 10.01.2025 [Agenda item no. 648.01 (xix)j: Timeline Steps Activity (Days) 1 Claimant Login Case-1 If Contractor is the Claimant, Contractor D+28 Either Contractor will submit the proposal to GM(Tech) enclosing (where D is the or NHAI date of following details decision of (a) Name of the Project DRB or DRB (b) of letter of Contractor conveying failed to give dissatisfaction on DRB decision decision) (c) Order of preference of 3 CCIEs (d) of Recommendation/ Decision of DRB or if DRB failed to give decision, copies of pleadings of Parties before DRB (e) Copy of the relevant clauses of the Concession/ Contract Agreement Contd__2I - HAT4 , '9 7 U 9 NHAL TH9 , AT , such Copy Copy
